medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral hyperglycemic chorea-ballism associated with diabetic ketoacidosis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient exhibited severe involuntary movements upon admission. These movements resolved within 48 hours following treatment with fluids and insulin, but very mild choreatic movements persisted in the upper extremities. Symptoms of choreatic movements and slowness began approximately 2 years prior, with a noticeable decline in insulin injection and blood glucose monitoring skills about 6 months before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 1 diabetes mellitus diagnosed at 10 years of age. No history of diabetes mellitus in the family.
medical_history.family_history: Mother diagnosed with Huntington's disease, symptoms began around age 35. An elder brother also has Huntington's disease.
medical_history.social_history: Unmarried, has been living alone since age 15, away from her hometown. Concealed family medical history from her healthcare providers.
